<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 310, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 380, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 764, 95]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(a^{2y} = \mathrm{e}^{3x + k}\), where \(a\) and \(k\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 88, 440, 109]]<|/det|>
The graph of \(y\) against \(x\) is a straight line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 117, 695, 144]]<|/det|>
Use logarithms to show that the gradient of the straight line is \(\frac{3}{2 \ln a}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 121, 917, 140]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 365, 186, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 365, 920, 403]]<|/det|>
Given that the straight line passes through the points (0.4, 0.95) and (3.3, 3.80), find the values of \(a\) and \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 384, 920, 403]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 77, 92, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 586, 100]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = \tan^2\left(\frac{1}{2}x\right)\) for \(0 \leqslant x < \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 109, 144, 128]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 107, 406, 129]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\operatorname {f}' \left(\frac{2}{3}\pi\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 149, 104]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 77, 487, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi} (f(x) + \sin x) \, \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 87, 94, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 78, 667, 115]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\int_{a}^{a^3} \frac{10}{2x + 1} \mathrm{~d}x = 7\), where \(a\) is a constant greater than 1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 131, 455, 153]]<|/det|>
Show that \(a = \sqrt[3]{0.5\mathrm{e}^{1.4}(2a + 1)} - 0.5.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 917, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 72, 381, 89]]<|/det|>
A curve has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 95, 603, 127]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{\mathrm{e}^{2t} - 2}{\mathrm{e}^{2t} + 1}, \quad y = \mathrm{e}^{3t} + 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 144, 146, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 141, 468, 165]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 144, 920, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 801, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the exact gradient of the curve at the point where the curve crosses the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 579, 92]]<|/det|>
Prove that \(\cos (\theta + 30^{\circ})\cos (\theta + 60^{\circ}) \equiv \frac{1}{4}\sqrt{3} - \frac{1}{2}\sin 2\theta .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 74, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 572, 185, 590]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 572, 722, 590]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(5\cos (2\alpha +30^{\circ})\cos (2\alpha +60^{\circ}) = 1\) for \(0^{\circ}< \alpha < 90^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 572, 920, 590]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 395, 141, 415]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 395, 702, 415]]<|/det|>
Show that the exact value of \(\cos 20^{\circ} \cos 50^{\circ} + \cos 40^{\circ} \cos 70^{\circ}\) is \(\frac{1}{2} \sqrt{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 396, 917, 415]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
